sense.name: mix of gases
sense.commentary: a mixture of gases (especially oxygen) required for breathing; the stuff of which the wind consists
sense.examples: Air pollution is bad. A smell of chemicals in the air... Open a window and let in some air. I need some fresh air. The air was cooled by the lake. As he waited he could feel the air on his neck. The brownies became hard because they were exposed to the air.

sense.name: spatial: above ground
sense.examples: Her hand stopped in mid air. He threw the ball into the air.

sense.name: aura
sense.commentary: atmosphere - a distinctive but intangible quality surrounding a person or thing
sense.examples: She seemed to have an air of mystery about her. The house had a neglected air. An air of defeat pervaded the candidate's headquaters. The place had a air of romance.

sense.name: air travel
sense.examples: Air travel involves too much waiting. If you've time to spare go by air.

sense.name: airwave
sense.commentary: medium for radio and television broadcasting
sense.examples: The program was on the air from 9 until midnight. The President used the airwaves to take his message to the people.

sense.name: tune
sense.commentary: melody, strain, melodic line, melodic phrase - a succession of notes forming a distinctive phrase
sense.examples: She was humming an air from Beethoven.

sense.name: element(Empedocles)
sense.commentary: once thought to be one of the four elements composing the universe
sense.examples: The book was about the four elements of the universe; air, fire, water...
